The climate crisis means that we are seeing more damage from flooding. Government must invest now in natural solutions. Bogs, moors, woodlands and wetlands act as giant sponges, absorbing water and slowing it down. Let's protect and rebuild these places. #FloodActionWeek üåéüí¶ https://t.co/eMlQdBqJLq

#WasteCrime is so much more than simply fly-tipping.

Waste criminals may dump waste on your land or property illegally, leaving you with the cost of clearing up.

Secure your premises and report suspicious waste activities anonymously to Crimestoppers online or call 0800 555 111 https://t.co/exrBNrP3jo

domain.name: TV Shows
domain.description: Television shows from around the world

entity.name: Great Canal Journeys
entity.description: Prunella Scales and Timothy West embark on canal journeys together, traversing the canals of the UK, Europe, and the rest of the world by canal barge and narrowboat. Their trips take them along many scenic waterways, including ancient routes followed by the Vikings in Sweden, the windmills along the canals near Amsterdam, and the route once taken by Casanova in Venice. Along the way they interact with interesting characters, taste regional dishes and explore the sights around the canals. Sheila Hancock and Gyles Brandreth host the twelfth season.

It's #FloodActionWeek ‚Äì find out how you can be prepared for flooding. 

Did you know that 5.2 million properties in England are at risk of #flooding? 

Would you know what to do in a flood? 

Do you have a flood plan? 

Find out now: https://t.co/ZEHl74ryiJ

@DrAlisonDunn @TrevorRenalsEA @FroggerWarren - Thank you to all that inputted into this work & particularly to the Environment Agency staff that helped facilitate this field-based study. Please RT. @BESInvasionSci @Invasivesnet @InvSp @YISF__INNS @SISI_project

We‚Äôre in the #RiverQuaggy at #GrovePark #Lewisham near to the restored @chinbrookmeadow to explore the potential to restore the entire stretch of the river between here and #SutcliffePark #Greenwich @Sutcliffe_Park aka #QuaggyLinks https://t.co/NXW6xFP1YD

#TeamEA are on call 24/7 to respond to environmental incidents. 

This weekend we responded to reports of a corrosive substance left in a watercourse in Burtonwood.

Seen something in a local watercourse that does not look right? Report it to us on 0800 80 70 60 https://t.co/fHae7olcub

Prep work and site investigations underway at #ThorneyIsland to assess ground conditions before new inter-tidal habitat and flood defences are built, compensating for losses due to rising sea levels & reducing impacts of climate change. @EnvAgencySE #thinkbigstartsmallscalefast https://t.co/c1zmhvXMEl

https://t.co/UpoEtVV9J0

Hull and East Riding has quite a low uptake to our flood warnings.  I wish this was different. There are well over 100,000 homes and businesses at risk, and thousands of hectares of land. #floodaware #prepareactsurvive https://t.co/xf5rMqMexV
